quotes: Salim served as African Water Ambassador since 2002, with responsibility for advocacy, sensitisation and mobilisation of support.

time_markers.text: Immediately after Zanzibar’s independence in 1963, the January 1964 revolution and the subsequent union between then Tanganyika and Zanzibar in the same year
quotes: Immediately after Zanzibar’s independence in 1963, the January 1964 revolution and the subsequent union between then Tanganyika and Zanzibar in the same year, Salim was assigned to represent the United Republic of Tanzania government in Egypt, India and China before being recalled home for various duties.

organizations.name: Eminent Persons Group on Small Arms and Light Weapons
quotes: Salim was also the co-chair of the Eminent Persons Group on Small Arms and Light Weapons, and a member of the Eminent Experts Group appointed by the UN secretary-general following the Durban World Conference against Racism, Racial Discrimination, Xenophobia and Related Intolerance.

organizations.name: Eminent Experts Group

organizations.name: Policy Advisory Commission of the World Intellectual Property Organization
quotes: He was also on the Policy Advisory Commission of the World Intellectual Property Organization.

organizations.name: African Development Bank
quotes: Following an invitation from the president of the African Development Bank, Salim served as African Water Ambassador since 2002, with responsibility for advocacy, sensitisation and mobilisation of support.

organizations.name: Tanzanian government
quotes: Throughout his service in the Tanzanian government, Salim has remained a strong believer and advocate for leadership ethics, integrity and commitment to serve the people.
